data.title: An Iranian actor and director Fathali Oveisi passed away
data.meta_description: Iran Theater- Iranian actor and director Fathali Oveisi passed away on Tuesday morning .
data.text:
He graduated in directing and acting from Texas State University in 1974. Oveisi returned to Iran and began his film career starring in Alireza Davoudnejad's film "Forbidden" in 1978.

The two films directed by him were Sarboland and Maryam and Mitil.

Fathali Oveisi, born on 11 January 1946, was an Iranian actor and director, known for Captain Khorshid (1987), Baanoo (1999), Hamoun (1990), The Love-stricken (1992) and Cactus.

He was also a singer and has released a music album called "Home of the Heart".

He went into a coma few days ago on 30 September 2021 after being struck by a huge stroke.
